de.ur.iw.navigame.data_download

Class AreaLevels

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ur.iw.navigame.data_download.AreaLevels
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServletRequestHandler

    public class AreaLevels
extends java.lang.Object
implements ServletRequestHandler
    Request handler that is responsible for downloading & showing the levels / storeys in a given area.

      Will print a list of storeys (with ids, map files...) for a given area.

      If the file exists: reads it and calls onSuccess; if it does not exist: downloads it, stores it and calls onSuccess

      Loads the XML-Parts of the file into a JSON-Object and then passes them on to a method that will check that all the images are on this server, then print the storey data to the client.

      Sends an internal server error as a response.

      Creates a JSON array containing objects with keys: { levelid: int, image_path: url, storey: int } and prints that object to the client as a JSON string.

    • Method Detail

      • handleRequest

        public void handleRequest(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> params,
                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Will print a list of storeys (with ids, map files...) for a given area.
        Specified by:
        handleRequest in interface ServletRequestHandler
        Parameters:
        params - request parameters. need to contain a "which_area" key.
        response - response that will receive the output / feedback.

      • loadAreaFile

        public void loadAreaFile(java.lang.String whichArea,
                J7Consumer<java.lang.String> onSuccess,
                J7Consumer<java.lang.Void> onError)
        If the file exists: reads it and calls onSuccess; if it does not exist: downloads it, stores it and calls onSuccess
        Parameters:
        whichArea - which area to load the storeys for.
        onSuccess - callback for when everything went okay
        onError - callback for if there was an error

      • downloadAreaFile

        private void downloadAreaFile(java.lang.String whichArea,
                    J7Consumer<java.lang.String> onSuccess,
                    J7Consumer<java.lang.Void> onError)
        Downloads the area file and calls onSuccess if it went OK.
        Parameters:
        whichArea - which area to load the storeys for.
        onSuccess - callback for when everything went okay
        onError - callback for if there was an error

      • onAreaFileLoaded

        private void onAreaFileLoaded(java.lang.String whichArea,
                    java.lang.String jsonContents,
                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Loads the XML-Parts of the file into a JSON-Object and then passes them on to a method that will check that all the images are on this server, then print the storey data to the client.
        Parameters:
        whichArea - which area to load the storeys for.
        jsonContents - json contents of an area file.
        response - response that will receive the output / feedback.

      • recursiveImageDownload

        private void recursiveImageDownload(java.lang.String whichArea,
                          org.json.JSONObject object,
                          int currentIndex,
                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Ensures that all images have been downloaded. This is called recursively because Thread iterations are hard to do. When all images are present, the data can finally be output.
        Parameters:
        whichArea - area index (PT, Mathematik etc.)
        object - the big JSON file containing all the levels and rooms.
        currentIndex - this is recursive, so this is just to keep track of which image files have been downloaded and what is next. index is of the "level"-array.
        response - response that is being passed around to avoid conflicts with multiple simultaneous requests.

      • storeImageFile

        private void storeImageFile(byte[] data,
                  java.lang.String whichArea,
                  org.json.JSONObject object,
                  int currentIndex,
                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Parameters:
        data - Bytes of the image file
        whichArea - area index (PT, Mathematik etc.)
        object - the big JSON file containing all the levels and rooms.
        currentIndex - this is recursive, so this is just to keep track of which image files have been downloaded and what is next. index is of the "level"-array.
        response - response that will receive the output / feedback.

      • checkSvg

        private boolean checkSvg(org.json.JSONObject levelObject)
        Currently, all the map files are called .png, even though some are .svg files. To cope with this - it causes problems!! - the files are read and, if they have an xml header, a new version of the file is created with a .svg ending.
        Parameters:
        levelObject - JSON object for one level / storey
        Returns:
        true, if the map file is an .svg file (even though it is probably called .png)

      • readAndPrintLevelInfo

        private void readAndPrintLevelInfo(org.json.JSONObject areaData,
                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Creates a JSON array containing objects with keys: 
         {
   levelid: int,
   image_path: url,
   storey: int
 }
        and prints that object to the client as a JSON string.
        Parameters:
        areaData - the big JSON file containing all the levels and rooms.
        response - response that will receive the output / feedback.

      • onDownloadError

        private void onDownloadError(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Sends an internal server error as a response.
        Parameters:
        response - response that will receive the output / feedback.
